thread.title: Images of Jong-Nam 'assassination' shown on CCTV
thread.title_full: Images of Jong-Nam 'assassination' shown on CCTV

title: Images of Jong-Nam 'assassination' shown on CCTV
text:
Images of Jong-Nam 'assassination' shown on CCTV By nine.com.au staff 
Extraordinary CCTV footage of the moments leading up to Kim Jong-Nam's death has been released on YouTube. 
The images taken inside Kuala Lumpur International Airport last Monday show a man walking into the lobby, checking flight schedules and approaching a self check-in kiosk. 
Two women then approach him from separate directions behind him, reports The Star , a Malaysian news outlet. 
One of the pair, a woman with shoulder-length hair appears to resemble Vietnam passport holder Doan Thi Huong who was arrested by Malaysian police in connection with the killing. 
She is seen placing her arms over his head before reaching over his face. 
A split second later she and the other woman hurriedly walk away. 
The man who appears to be Jong-Nam, the estranged half brother of North Korean ruler Kim Jong-Un, walks quickly to an information counter and speaks to staff there. 
Footage then shows him being escorted by two uniformed policemen, and Jon-Nam is seen gesturing with his hands, as if explaining what had happened to him. 
They then take him to the airport clinic. 
Jong-Nam was treated there and transferred by ambulance to hospital but died during the journey. 
Investigators arrested Huong, an Indonesian woman and a North Korean man, identified as Ri Jong Chol, in connection with his death, Reuters reports. 
Police are also hunting four North Korean nationals who left Malaysia on the day of the killing. 
Selangor state police chief Abdul Samah told Reuters that the autopsy report was not complete yet.
